definitions.text: the act of delivering a blow with the foot
examples: he gave the ball a powerful kick

definitions.text: the swift release of a store of affective force
examples: they got a great bang out of it
he got a quick rush from injecting heroin

definitions.text: the backward jerk of a gun when it is fired

examples: I have a gripe about the service here

definitions.text: the sudden stimulation provided by strong drink (or certain drugs)
examples: a sidecar is a smooth drink but it has a powerful kick

definitions.text: a rhythmic thrusting movement of the legs as in swimming or calisthenics
examples: the kick must be synchronized with the arm movements
the swimmer's kicking left a wake behind him

definitions.text: drive or propel with the foot
thrash about or strike out with the feet
spring back, as from a forceful thrust
examples: The gun kicked back into my shoulder
He kicked the extra point after touchdown

definitions.text: express complaints, discontent, displeasure, or unhappiness
examples: She has a lot to kick about
